title: GOP rep says would - be Trump assassin had encrypted messaging accounts in 3 foreign countries , rips intelligence community
message:
The gunman who nearly assassinated former President Donald Trump used encrypted messaging accounts on platforms in multiple foreign countries, according to a GOP representative appointed to a congressional task force investigating the assassination attempt.
Rep. Mike Waltz (R-Fla.) — a member of the Bipartisan House Task Force on the attempted assassination of Donald Trump — revealed the three countries linked to encrypted messaging accounts used by would-be Trump assassin Thomas Matthew Crooks.
"And so you've got to work over there with the FBI liaisons overseas to start getting into them through their authorities."

title: Man repeatedly stabbed near Salley ; suspect in custody
message:
SALLEY, S.C. (WRDW/WAGT) - A man suffered injuries and a suspect is in custody after a stabbing near Salley on Thursday night, according to Aiken County deputies.
The victim, a man in his 20s, suffered stab wounds to his chest, back and arm in the incident on Jewelweed Road near Tabernacle Road.
Emergency medical crews were still treating him at the scene as of 6:30 p.m.A suspect was taken into custody, deputies said.

title: Ukraine war briefing : Fierce fighting on Pokrovsk front as Russia claims gains
message:
Russian forces mounted 53 attacks on the Pokrovsk front in Donetsk oblast on Thursday as Moscow pressed to take the town, which Kyiv’s military described as the main focus of the invaders’ efforts in Ukraine.
Elsewhere in eastern Ukraine, Russian forces attacked Ukrainian positions near the settlement of Niu-York.
Allies including the US are supplying weapons to Ukrainian forces but have imposed restrictions on how and when they can be used inside Russia.
A Russian strike killed a 56-year-old man and injured eight others in the Kharkiv region of north-east Ukraine, the Ukrainian prosecutor general’s office said on Thursday.
The injured included a 15-year-old boy, while residential buildings were also damaged in the Russian strike on the village of Bohodukhiv, the prosecutor general’s office said.

title: Police can now search for knives in shopping centres , licensed premises
message:
Legislation to extend the powers of police officers to randomly stop and search people have been passed through Queensland Parliament this week during the penultimate sitting before the state election on October 26.
The legislation called Jack’s Law allows police to “wand” (search with handheld metal detectors) people in safe night precincts, public transport stations and on public transport without a warrant.
Legislation will now allow police to conduct warrantless searches of people in shopping centres, sporting clubs and retail settings.
Credit: Cloe ReadThe scope of those powers will now be extended to people in shopping centres, high-risk retail premises such as convenience stores, sporting and entertainment venues, licensed venues and on train lines.
Premier Steven Miles said the extension is designed to capture public places characterised by high pedestrian density.

title: Report : Palestinian Islamic Jihad Still Holding 7 Hostages , Strengthening Ties With Hamas
message:
According to a report by the Saudi newspaper Asharq al-Awsat, the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) terror group is still holding seven Israeli hostages, who were captured on October 7.
This follows an earlier statement from PIJ leader Ziyad Nakhaleh, who announced on October 8 that the group had taken more than 30 of the 251 hostages abducted during the Hamas-led massacre in southern Israel a day prior.
While some of the hostages were released during a temporary truce in November, it remains unclear whether any of those still in PIJ custody have died.
The report also highlights growing cooperation between Hamas and PIJ, particularly after the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran last month.
(YWN World Headquarters – NYC)

title: Russian forces destroy French - made Crotale missile system in Kursk Region
message:
Russian forces used an FPV drone to destroy French-made Crotale all-weather, short-range surface-to-air missile system worth almost $9 million in the Kursk Region, Deputy Head of the Russian Armed Forces’ Main Military-Political Department, Akhmat Special Forces Commander Major General Apty Alaudinov said.
"Fighters of the Aida team of the Akhmad Special Forces burned down a Crotale missile system deployed in an attempt to intercept our helicopters on a mission to deliver a strike on Martynovka," he said.
"This system costs eight million euro ($8.9 million), and my troops used an FPV drone worth around 60,000 rubles (approximately $660) to destroy it."
In his words,"the adversary was attacking in many directions" on Thursday.
"In all, military units deployed within our zone of responsibility <…> destroyed eight pieces of military hardware in total today, including one tank and three armored combat vehicles," Alaudinov said.

title: Indian PM Modi to advocate  peace  on historic Ukraine visit
message:
He is the first Indian premier to visit Ukraine.
A diplomatic breakthrough between Moscow and Kyiv looks more elusive than ever following Ukraine's shock offensive into Russia's western Kursk region.
It is also unclear whether Modi himself could be an effective dealmaker, seen by many in Ukraine as too close to Russian President Vladimir Putin.
Modi recently drew fresh condemnation in Kyiv for hugging the Russian leader during a visit to Moscow in July.
More recently they have clashed over allegations Indian citizens were duped into fighting with Russian soldiers on the frontlines.

title: Modi to meet Zelenskiy in Ukraine amid controversy over hug for Putin
message:
A diplomatic breakthrough between Moscow and Kyiv appears more elusive than ever after Ukraine’s surprise offensive into Russia’s western Kursk region.

Modi said he planned to “share perspectives on peaceful resolution of the ongoing Ukraine conflict” with Zelenskiy, as well as discussing “deepening the India-Ukraine friendship”.
But ties have also been strained over the conflict, with Putin in 2022 publicly acknowledging that Modi had “concerns” about Russia’s invasion.

title: Gwangju explosion caused by disgruntled dental patient : police
message:
Police officials on Thursday are acquiring a makeshift explosive, box filled with canisters of butane gas and flammable materials, used in an explosion that occurred earlier at a Gwangju dental clinic.
(Yonhap)A 79-year-old man who caused an explosion and fire at a dental clinic Thursday in Gwangju had done so out of dissatisfaction with the clinic, according to local police.
The incident occurred at 1:14 p.m., when the suspect set off an explosion with a makeshift device in the reception area of the dental clinic on the third floor of a building in Seo-gu, Gwangju.
The explosion caused a fire that forced the evacuation of some 90 people in the building.
The incident initially caused a terrorism scare, leading to a police strike team being dispatched to the scene.

title: Iraqi Airstrike Destroyed Daesh Hideout In E . Province , Killing Militants
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) BAGHDAD, Aug 23 (NNN-NINA) – The Iraqi military announced yesterday that, it had conducted an in the eastern province of Diyala, destroying a Daesh hideout and killing all inside.
Based on intelligence reports, the Iraqi military sent F-16 fighter jets to attack the Daesh hideout in the Hamrin mountain range, in northern Diyala at 7:00 a.m. local time (0400 GMT), according to a statement released by the Security Cell, an outlet of the Iraqi Joint Operations Command.
The statement added, the destroyed hideout served as a logistical support site for the terrorists.
Captain Asaad Salman, from the federal police, said that, a team of soldiers and federal police was sent to the scene, where they discovered scattered remains of militants, along with weapons, ammunition, and other logistical materials.
The death toll was not specified.– NNN-NINA

title: Gabby Giffords recounts her own shooting in DNC remarks
message:
The NPR Network will be reporting live from Chicago throughout the week bringing you the latest on the Democratic National Convention.
Following joint remarks from the loved ones of shooting victims, gun safety activist Gabby Giffords addressed the DNC crowd to recount her own experiences with gun violence.
Everybody called me a rising star,” said Giffords, who was joined onstage by her husband, Arizona Sen. Mark Kelly.
“I learned to walk again one step at a time.
I learned to talk again one word at a time.”After the shooting, Giffords and her husband launched a gun violence prevention advocacy and research center.

title: Bridgeton man arrested for false police calls
message:
BRIDGETON — A city man who allegedly made two separate false calls to police as a diversion last month was arrested on warrants Tuesday, police said.
Elijah Money, 28, was charged with obstruction of justice, resisting arrest, defiant trespass, contempt, calling 911 without needing 911 services and providing false information to police.
Officers checked on both calls and determined they were unfounded.
They then determined the calls were made as diversions to get police to leave the Burlington Manor complex, and that the calls were made by Money.
On Tuesday, Money was seen at the same apartment complex by officers, who knew he had an outstanding warrant for his arrest.

title: US to announce $125 million military aid package to Ukraine , AP reports
message:
US to announce $125 million military aid package for Ukraine, AP reportsThe U.S. is preparing to announce a military aid package for Ukraine worth about $125 million, the Associated Press reported on Aug. 22, citing unnamed American officials.
The sources spoke to AP on the condition of anonymity, as the aid package has not been publicly announced.
The new military package will come from Presidential Drawdown Authority, a mechanism that allows the president to deliver weaponry to allies from current U.S. stockpiles.
In April, the U.S. passed a long-awaited $61 billion aid package, with much of it covering military aid.
Most recently, the U.S. provided Ukraine with a $125 million aid package on Aug. 9.

title: Secret Service Pittsburgh employees placed on administrative leave : report
message:
Several members of the U.S. Secret Service Pittsburgh Field Office have reportedly been placed on administrative leave following the July 13 assassination attempt against former President Trump in Butler, Pennsylvania.
Former Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle resigned less than two weeks after the shooting and after giving her initial testimony about the event before members of Congress.
WATCH:"I f---ing told them they need to post the f---ing guys over here … the Secret Service," the officer says in the video.

title: Iraqi airstrike destroys IS hideout in E . province , killing militants
message:
You are here:视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器BAGHDAD, Aug. 22 (Xinhua) -- The Iraqi military announced on Thursday that it had conducted an airstrike in the eastern province of Diyala, destroying an Islamic State (IS) hideout and killing all militants inside.
Based on intelligence reports, the Iraqi military sent F-16 fighter jets to attack the IS hideout in the Hamrin mountain range in northern Diyala at 7:00 a.m. local time (0400 GMT), according to a statement released by the Security Media Cell, a media outlet of the Iraqi Joint Operations Command.
The statement added that the destroyed hideout served as a logistical support site for IS terrorists.
Captain Asaad Salman from the federal police told Xinhua that a team of soldiers and federal police was sent to the scene, where they discovered scattered remains of militants, along with weapons, ammunition, and other logistical materials.
The death toll was not specified.

title: Hezbollah rockets hit Golan Heights after Israel strikes deep in Lebanon | Times of Suriname – grootste landelijk dagblad van Suriname
message:
GOLAN – Hezbollah has launched dozens of rockets at the occupied Golan Heights after Israeli aircraft struck deep inside Lebanon, as fears of an all-out war grow.
The Israeli military said it hit Hezbollah weapons storage facilities in the Bekaa Valley overnight.
In response, Hezbollah, which is backed by Iran, said it targeted Israeli military positions in the Golan with a rocket barrage.
Tensions have risen in recent weeks after Israel killed a senior Hezbollah commander in Beirut, who it blamed for the killing of 12 children in a rocket attack.
In response to the strikes, Hezbollah said it had launched a barrage of rockets towards an IDF logistics base in the Golan Heights.

title: Ukrainian Strike Sinks Fuel - Laden Ferry in Russian Port
message:
Ukraine sank a Russian ferry carrying fuel tanks in an aerial attack on a southern Russian port Kavkaz next to the annexed Crimean peninsula on Thursday, August 22, Russian officials reported, initially describing it as an "attempted terrorist attack by the Kyiv regime."
Kyiv has heavily targeted Crimea -- a key logistics and military hub for Moscow -- since Russia launched its full-scale military offensive in February 2022.
"A railroad ferry carrying fuel was hit in the port of Kavkaz," the Russian governor of the Krasnodar region, where the port is located, said in a post on Telegram.
AdvertisementPreliminary reports indicated that five individuals were aboard the ferry during the attack, but their status remains uncertain.
The first reports of the shelling came from Russian and Ukrainian telegram channels, where eyewitnesses shared photos and videos of the fire.

title: Pakistan : 11 policemen killed , 7 injured in Punjab ambush
message:
At least 11 policemen were killed and seven others injured after dacoits ambushed police vehicles in Pakistan’s eastern Punjab province, police officials said.
The sudden rocket attack occurred when one of the vehicles developed a malfunction, and policemen stopped for automotive repair, killing 11 policemen on the spot while injuring seven others, police said.
AdvertisementFollowing the attack, rescue and police teams reached the site and shifted the injured to a nearby hospital, where at least two policemen are in critical condition.
Taking notice of the incident, Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif strongly condemned the attack on a police convoy, directing immediate and effective action against the attackers.
The entire nation pays tribute to the brave and dedicated officers and personnel of the police force,” he added.

title: Modi Historic Kyiv Visit : Diplomacy Amid Conflict
message:
In a historic diplomatic move, India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit wartime Kyiv for pivotal talks with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
The visit comes during a particularly volatile period in the Ukraine-Russia conflict.
Ukrainian forces remain in Russia's western Kursk region after their August incursion, while Russian troops make slow gains in Ukraine's east.
Modi's visit follows his July trip to Moscow, highlighting Kyiv's ongoing efforts to strengthen global diplomatic relations and seek a fair settlement to end the war.
The visit is seen as crucial for both India and Ukraine, amid a backdrop of evolving geopolitical dynamics.

title: Ukraine tried to strike Kursk nuclear plant
message:
Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday accused Ukraine of trying to strike Russia's Kursk nuclear power plant in an overnight attack and said Moscow had informed the UN nuclear safety watchdog about the situation.
Acting Kursk Governor Alexei Smirnov told Putin that the situation at the Kursk plant, which has four Soviet graphite-moderated RBMK-1000 reactors, was stable.
"The enemy tried to strike at the nuclear power plant during the night today," Putin told a meeting on the situation in Russian border regions.
"The International Atomic Energy Agency has been informed, they promise to come themselves and send specialists to assess the situation," Putin said.
Rafael Grossi, director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), on August 9 appealed for maximum restraint to avoid a nuclear accident at the Kursk plant.

title: PM Modi In Kyiv : Is India the Key To Peace Between Russia and Ukraine ?
message:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Kyiv for a historic visit, marking the first trip by an Indian leader to Ukraine since it gained independence from the Soviet Union in 1991.
Modi had used strong language to indirectly criticize Russian President Vladimir Putin following a Russian missile strike on a Ukrainian children’s hospital.
The attack led to criticism from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who expressed disappointment over Modi’s Moscow visit, calling it a setback for peace efforts.

title: King Charles III Unveils Rare Personal Health Update Amid Cancer Diagnosis
message:
King Charles III shared a "rare" personal update concerning his cancer diagnosis on Thursday (August 22) while visiting with families affected by the Southport knife attack.
King Charles III announced his cancer diagnosis in February 2024 and returned to public engagements on April 26th, upon which Buckingham Palace noted he was "very grateful to his medical team for their continued care and expertise."
In May, the 75-year-old royal revealed that he lost his sense of taste as a side effect of undergoing chemotherapy.
King Charles III is not the only member of the British royal family currently undergoing cancer treatments, as Kate Middleton unveiled earlier this year that she was diagnosed with abdominal cancer and asked for privacy as she attempts to battle the disease.
Information regarding what form of cancer the King possesses has yet to be revealed as he proceeds with chemotherapy treatments.

message:

King Charles III shared a "rare" personal update concerning his cancer diagnosis on Thursday (August 22) while visiting with families affected by the Southport knife attack.
King Charles III announced his cancer diagnosis in February 2024 and returned to public engagements on April 26th, upon which Buckingham Palace noted he was "very grateful to his medical team for their continued care and expertise."
In May, the 75-year-old royal revealed that he lost his sense of taste as a side effect of undergoing chemotherapy.
King Charles III is not the only member of the British royal family currently undergoing cancer treatments, as Kate Middleton unveiled earlier this year that she was diagnosed with abdominal cancer and asked for privacy as she attempts to battle the disease.
Information regarding what form of cancer the King possesses has yet to be revealed as he proceeds with chemotherapy treatments.

title: Im gonna study war no more - Kaieteur News
message:
I’m gonna study war no moreDear Editor,It’s about time we learn from our shared experiences.
As a youngster, my parents and Uncle Joe talked about the Battle for Stalingrad.
They also talked about the attack on Pearl Harbour earlier, which changed what began as a European Civil War in 1939 into a full-blown World War.
The German battle plan was very effective until later when the Russian sharpshooters, dug into trenches, learned how to punish the German fliers.
It may be helpful if we subscribe to the words and lyrics sung by Mahalia Jackson – I’m gonna lay down my burden, down by the Riverside…I’m gonna study war no more.

title: Aircraft carrier Bush gets first - ever Stingray drone control room
message:
The aircraft carrier George H.W.
Bush is now sporting the world’s first air drone warfare center, a control room that will host operators of the MQ-25 Stingray refueling drone in the not-too-distant future, the Navy has confirmed.
The ground control station was part of a multiyear effort that took place aboard Bush during multiple ship maintenance stints and between deployments, Naval Air Systems Command, or NAVAIR, said.
Behold, the world's first unmanned air warfare center, recently installed aboard the aircraft carrier George H.W.
(U.S. Navy)Standing up the Bush’s drone control room “lays the foundation” for how the Navy will operate and control unmanned aircraft, Unmanned Carrier Aviation (PMA-268) Program Manager Capt.

title: Sudan : August 2024 Update
message:
August 22, 2024: Civil war has returned to Sudan with intense combat between the army and the rebel Rapid Support Forces (RSF).
The RSF was established in 2013 as a paramilitary force that fought alongside the army to suppress ongoing violence in the western Sudan region of Darfur.
The RSF continues to attack civilians as well as fighting the Sudanese army.
By 2024 the violence against Sudanese Christians continued with the RSF doing most of the attacking.
The war in Darfur ended in 2020, with over 300,000 dead, many of them Sudanese Christians.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 22 August 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
In addition, the zagarbniki used 556 kamikaze drones for strikes and carried out more than 3,300 shelling at the positions of Ukrainian troops and settlements.
In the Kharkiv direction, Russian terrorists twice unsuccessfully stormed the positions of Ukrainian units in the Vovchansk district.
Two armoured fighting vehicles and seven Ukrainian troops were eliminated, one Ukrainian serviceman was taken prisoner.

title: The Air Force wants to build lots of bases around the Pacific . But it still needs to determine how to protect them .
message:
The Air Force and Army need to figure out how to provide base defense for small outposts around the Pacific before a key Air Force operating plan can succeed, according to the service’s top officer.
And while the Army and Air Force are working together, the services have different responsibilities and priorities for air base defense.
“There's been dialogue and an understanding between the Army and the Air Force and [the Defense Secretary’s office] that we'll work together on coming up with this.
I haven't signed a [memorandum of understanding], but there still is an understanding, and so the Army is sorting out how to do it for air bases.
The U.S. will also need to defend its Pacific bases against non-kinetic threats like cyber attacks and electronic warfare, Allvin said, which will require different protections.

title: The US Is Sending $125 Million in New Military Aid to Ukraine , Officials Say
message:
WASHINGTON — The Biden administration will send about $125 million in new military aid to Ukraine, U.S. officials said Thursday, even as Washington works to get a better understanding of Kyiv's incursion into Russia and how it advances the broader battlefield goals more than two years into the war.
The officials spoke on condition of anonymity because the aid has not been publicly announced.
The aid comes as Ukrainian forces continue to broaden their surprise offensive into Russia, where officials say they have taken about 100 square kilometers (62 square miles) of territory around Kursk.
He said Kyiv’s military had taken control of another Russian village and captured more prisoners of war.
The latest package of aid brings the total amount of U.S. security assistance to Ukraine to more than $55.7 billion since Russia's invasion in February 2022.

title: Star Wars : The Battle of Jakku - Republic Under Siege announced by Marvel
message:
Last month Marvel announced that it will be taking its Star Wars comics into post-Return of the Jedi territory to explore the final days of the Galactic Civil War with a trilogy of miniseries under the Star Wars: The Battle of Jakku banner.
Things will get underway in October with Star Wars: The Battle of Jakku – Insurgency Rising from writer Alex Segura and artists Leonard Kirk and Stefano Raffaele, and now Marvel has revealed that Segura and Raffaele will reunite for the second chapter, Star Wars: The Battle of Jakku – Republic Under Siege.
The heroes find themselves saved in the nick of time – by a fan-favorite guest star and ally!
STAR WARS: THE BATTLE OF JAKKU – REPUBLIC UNDER SIEGE #2Written by ALEX SEGURAArt by STEFANO RAFFAELELUKE AND DOCTOR APHRA JOIN FORCES TO FIGHT OFF A SURPRISE ATTACK AS THE REMAINING IMPERIALS PLOT THEIR NEXT ATTACK!
“It’s an unbelievable honor to be able to tell this lost story of Star Wars history, alongside so many amazing artists, in the pages of the three BATTLE OF JAKKU limited series,” states Segura.

title: $5 million grant to address combat wound infections in Ukraine
message:
Adit Ginde, MD, MPH, professor of emergency medicine and principal investigator of the projectGinde worked with the CU Center for Combat Medicine and Battlefield (COMBAT) Research team to secure the research award.
Currently, no systematic data collection for wound infection exists in Ukraine, so creating scalable infrastructure for that purpose is an urgent need.
"Our plan is to collect important data on wound infection, but also to create a scalable infrastructure so that we can address other areas," Ginde says.
Dr. Ginde and his team are visionaries, and they understand that this research will help patients in Ukraine and globally."
This effort was funded under MTEC solicitation MTEC-24-01-MPAI and is funded by Combat Casualty Research Program (CCCRP) under the Department of Defense.

title: Winning : Long Term Ukrainian Prospects
message:
August 23, 2024: The NATO alliance supporting Ukraine in its battle against Russian invaders believes that Ukrainian victory is inevitable.
While Russia has nuclear weapons, so do several NATO members as in the Americans, Britain and France.
While doing this Ukraine will continue to replace Soviet era Russian weapons and equipment and replace it with European or American items that NATO members use.
Russian leader Vladimir Putin started the war and, so far, he refuses to acknowledge the possibility of defeat.
Now that defeat is a reality, Putin is trying to improvise some reasonably convincing story about how Russia actually won.

title: Russia hits Ukraine with 2 ballistic missiles and 16 attack drones overnight
message:
Stock photo: General Staff of the Armed Forces of UkraineUkrainian air defence systems shot down 14 of the 16 Shahed attack drones launched at Ukraine on the night of 22-23 August.
Source: Mykola Oleshchuk, Commander of Ukraine's Air Force, on TelegramQuote: "The enemy attacked [Ukraine] with two Iskander-M/KN-23 ballistic missiles from Voronezh Oblast and 16 Shahed attack UAVs, launched from Yeysk and Kursk in Russia."
Details: Aircraft, electronic warfare units and mobile firing groups of the Ukrainian defence forces shot down 14 Shahed drones.
Visual contact with another two was lost, but no information on damage was received.
Air defence responded to the Russian attacks in Cherkasy, Kirovohrad, Poltava and Sumy oblasts.

title: IDF announces Sergeant Ori Ashkenazi Nechemya killed in Gaza Strip
message:
Sergeant Ori Ashkenazi Nechemya was killed in battle while fighting in the Gaza Strip, the IDF announced on Thursday.
Sergeant Ashkenazi Nechemya, 19, from Ashkelon, served in the 46th Battalion in the 401st Brigade.
Ashkenazi Nechemya fell in southern Gaza Strip.
Ashkenazi Nechemya left behind his parents, a sister and brother.
Soldiers killed since beginning of warAccording to the IDF's tally, the death of Sergeant Ashkenazi Nechemya raises the total of soldiers killed on or since October 7 of last year to 695.

title: Renan Ferreira scalded for controversial comments made towards Francis Ngannou as he gets emotional during PFL press conference
message:
Ahead of Francis Ngannou’s highly anticipated PFL debut against Renan Ferreira on October 19, the two took part in a press conference this Thursday and fans have scaled Ferreira for some extremely controversial comments.
After taking his talents to the boxing ring at the end of last year and again at the beginning of this year, Francis Ngannou‘s MMA return was finally announced to take place in October, where he’ll take on PFL heavyweight champion, Renan Ferreira.
Ferreira earned the shot to take on the heavyweight star after knocking out Bellator heavyweight champion Ryan Bader in February, during a champion vs champion event.
Unfortunately, though, during the press conference ‘Problema’ made an extremely disrespectful comment towards the 37-year-old former UFC heavyweight champion.
One fan commented on X: “One of those instances where I won’t be too concerned if he takes a while waking up lol.”Another fan commented: “Incredibly crass thing for Renan Ferreira to say.

title: On frontline island , Taiwan president rejects China rule for freedom
message:
Ceremony commemorating the war against Chinese forces on the frontline island in KinmenCeremony commemorating the war against Chinese forces on the frontline island in KinmenBy Fabian Hamacher and Ann WangKINMEN, Taiwan (Reuters) - Taiwan wants to continue its free way of life and rejects being ruled by China's Communist Party, Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Friday, visiting a frontline island between the two sides to mark a key battle with Chinese forces.
"Our aim is that we hope for peaceful development across the Taiwan Strait.
Taiwan sent its own forces to keep watch, the ministry said, using its usual wording for when China carries out such activities.
"The two sides of the Taiwan Strait need peace," she added, having met Song Tao, the head of China's Taiwan Affairs Office, in Beijing on Thursday to discuss re-opening the islands to Chinese tourists.
Formerly called Quemoy in English, Kinmen today is a popular tourist destination, though Taiwan maintains a significant military presence.

title: On frontline island , Taiwan president rejects China rule for freedom
message:
KINMEN, Taiwan (Reuters) - Taiwan wants to continue its free way of life and rejects being ruled by China's Communist Party, Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Friday, visiting a frontline island between the two sides to mark a key battle with Chinese forces.
Taiwan must resist China's threats, Lai added.
"Our aim is that we hope for peaceful development across the Taiwan Strait.
"The two sides of the Taiwan Strait need peace," she added, having met Song Tao, the head of China's Taiwan Affairs Office, in Beijing on Thursday to discuss re-opening the islands to Chinese tourists.
Formerly called Quemoy in English, Kinmen today is a popular tourist destination, though Taiwan maintains a significant military presence.

title: Judge says 3M cant escape liability in earplug lawsuits
message:
Editor’s note: This story has been updated at 7:50am EDT Aug. 29 to reflect the timeline of the 2018 settlement.
A federal judge recently told 3M that it may not use “bad faith manipulation” to avoid its responsibility in a slew of cases against the multinational conglomerate for its allegedly defective earplugs.
“We applaud Judge Rodger[s’] order, which shuts the door on 3M’s duplicitous, bad faith attempt to shift blame...in service of its contrived bankruptcy maneuver,” they said.
In August, an attempt by 3M to have one of its subsidiaries, Aearo Technologies LLC, declare bankruptcy was denied by an Indiana bankruptcy judge, Military Times previously reported.
The legal fight against 3M dates back to allegations that led to a settlement in 2018.

message:

message:

title: The challenge of disinformation - Opinion - Business Recorder
message:
Social media platforms such as Facebook, X, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube have become integral to our daily lives, rapidly delivering updates on current affairs, entertainment, economic issues etc.
These platforms provide diverse opportunities for people worldwide to monetize their skills, whether through video content, social media campaigns, or live streaming.
The recent occurrence in the United Kingdom highlights the impact of misinformation on the Brexit referendum, demonstrating how social media disinformation campaigns have contributed to political polarization.
China’s Cybersecurity Law and the Data Security Law mandate social media platforms to adhere to state guidelines and conduct regular content monitoring.
In Pakistan, social media has significantly contributed to the spread of disinformation, heightening societal polarization and impacting the economy, governance, and moral culture.

title: India Modi visits Poland for security and trade talks en route to war - torn Ukraine - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is visiting Poland for top-level security and trade talks before heading to neighboring Ukraine, which is at war with India’s strategic partner, Russia.
Modi will hold talks Thursday in Warsaw with Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk and President Andrzej Duda, which are expected to focus on security, especially in the region bordering Ukraine.
Ukraine chastised Modi for his visit to Moscow last month, when he met and hugged President Vladimir Putin.
Modi has avoided condemning Russia while emphasizing a peaceful settlement to the war in Ukraine.
In a statement ahead of his arrival in the NATO and European Union member nation, Modi said Poland remains India’s key economy partner in Central Europe.

title: Worthplaying |  Rogue Water Is A Tactical Turn - based Rogue - lite Coming To PC In September
message:
Rogue Waters is a tactical turn-based rogue-lite set in a pirate world overtaken by a terrible curse.
Chart your course through an ever-changing game world, and turn the tides of battle on land or sea in a fresh take on tactical turn-based combat.
"Bringing Rogue Waters to life has been a real adventure," said Mateusz Pilski, Vice President of Development at Ice Code Games.
Dynamic melee combat which recreates the dance-like fencing bouts of boarding actions, combines immersion with thoughtful planning."
Rogue Waters is coming to PC (Steam /Epic Games Store) on Sept. 30, 2024 and is available to pre-order now for an additional 20% discount ahead of its launch.

title: Russia pushes forward in Ukraine east as Kursk offensive slows
message:

Analysts say one aim of Ukraine’s offensive into western Russia has been to force Moscow to divert troops from the eastern front lines.
The Ukrainian offensive in Russia has had little impact on the fighting in the Donetsk region, he said.
Over the past week, Ukraine has only marginally advanced around the bulge of territory it seized, pushing into a few villages.
Analysts say this is because the Ukrainian forces are coming up against reinforcements that Moscow has sent to the area, mainly from units stationed in Russia.

title: Bengal Jordan Battle scores pick - six off Colts QB Anthony Richardson
message:
While preseason may not have any real regular season implications for teams, there will certainly be bright spots from the three games teams are allotted before the start of the 17-game season.
However, fans did get a treat Thursday, as 2023 third-round pick Jordan Battle picked off Anthony Richardson and took it to the house.
Richardson is the Colts’ starting quarterback for this upcoming season after being drafted fourth overall in 2023, making this touchdown even more impressive for Battle.
Jordan Battle said GIMME THAT pic.twitter.com/jgr1NMe9wz — Willie Lutz (@willie_lutz) August 23, 2024Battle ended last season with 71 tackles, two sacks, and an interception.
If he continues to read the eyes of the quarterback like he did with Richardson, there’s no doubt we may be seeing more of Battle on the field when games start to matter the most.

title: Gaza war extends toll on Israel economy | Israel - Palestine conflict
message:
Heightened tensions between Israel and Iran could incur ‘significant additional military spending’ for Israel, further straining its finances.
Last week, Fitch Ratings downgraded Israel’s credit score from A+ to A. Fitch cited the continued war in Gaza and heightened geopolitical risks as key drivers.
So far, Israel’s war on Gaza has killed more than 40,000 Palestinians and decimated the economy in the besieged Palestinian enclave.
Separately, Fitch warned that heightened tensions between Israel and Iran could incur “significant additional military spending” for Israel.
Slowing growthBefore the outbreak of the war, Israel’s economy was forecast to grow by 3.5 percent last year.

title: Modi , Tusk Enter Pact to Boost Ties
message:
It may be noted that Poland is a key supporter of Ukraine in the conflict and every world leader visiting Ukraine after the conflict began has had to enter that country through Poland.
He will then be in Kyiv for around seven hours on Friday, before returning to Poland the same way.
The Polish PM said the two leaders had discussed important “emotional” issues and appreciated Modi’s readiness to work towards ending the Ukraine conflict through peaceful means.
Tusk expressed Poland’s readiness to invest in the defence manufacturing sector and also strengthen ties in the agro-food sector.
Referring to bilateral defence ties as proof of the mutual trust of the two nations in each other, Mr Modi invited Polish companies to “make in India” and “make for the world”.

title: Russia accuses Ukraine of trying to attack Kursk nuclear power plant with drone
message:
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russia accused Ukraine on Friday of trying to attack the Kursk nuclear power station overnight in what it called an act of "nuclear terrorism", days before the head of the U.N. atomic watchdog is due to visit the site.
The nuclear plant is located in the Kursk region of western Russia, where fierce fighting has raged since Ukrainian forces launched a surprise incursion on Aug. 6.
Russian state news agency TASS quoted an unnamed source as saying the drone was shot down near a storage facility for spent nuclear fuel.
The head of the IAEA, Rafael Grossi, is due to visit the power station next week.
Russian President Vladimir Putin first accused Ukraine on Thursday of trying to attack the facility, and said Moscow had informed the IAEA.

title: At UN , Pakistan urges  new thinking  to effectively prevent conflicts , build peace
message:
Pakistan has called for ‘new thinking’ to shape effective approaches to prevent conflicts, resolving disputes — such as Kashmir & Palestine — and building peace in conflict-hit countries.
“Prevention and peace building can break the cycle of violence and lay the foundations to ensure sustainable development is possible for all,” Elizabeth Spehar, Assistant Secretary-General for Peace building Support, said.
The Commission was set up in 2020 as part of broader efforts to prevent, manage and mitigate conflicts.
It has established peace coalitions, as well as early warning and response mechanisms, across all 16 districts in Sierra Leone.
“By engaging a wide range of local actors, the ICPNC ensures that peace building efforts are grounded in the realities and needs of communities,” she said.

title: AI , surveillance , China , biometrics , privacy | Homeland Security Newswire
message:
Xi has made AI a strategic priority and wants its development to move quickly.
To do this, Xi wants China to harness ‘new quality productive forces’ that will drive disruptive breakthroughs and not merely produce incremental improvements on existing technologies.
China hopes to acquire ‘leapfrog’ technology, particularly in military AI, which it hopes can change the military balance of power by giving the PLA an overwhelming edge.
Debates about the future potential of AI by military analysts in China focus on developing the PLA’s ‘intelligentised warfare’ capabilities, referring to the aim of using AI to control the will of the enemy’s top decision-makers.
If successful, AI has the potential to bring about revolutionary changes in the way militaries operate and warfare is conducted—comparable to mechanized warfare, information warfare, and even nuclear warfare.

I think I'm battling with it here.

title: Walking the cultural tightrope
message:
A scene from acrobatic drama Xiansheng (Starting Sounds), a production by the Shenyang Acrobatic Performing Arts Corp, which kick-starts the 12th China Acrobatic Exhibition in Shenyang, Liaoning province, on Friday.
Forming human pyramids on bicycles, swinging midair on a flying trapeze, walking along a tightrope while another performer balances on top doing a handstand — acrobatic performances often draw gasps and applause for their spine-tingling feats.
The production is set to open the 12th China Acrobatic Exhibition, which is taking place until Sept 5 in Shenyang.
The other four acts and three dramas are supported by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism's 2024 China Acrobatic Art Innovation Project.
From its 10th edition in 2019, it was renamed the China Acrobatic Exhibition, and the competition was replaced by a series of performances.
